intro: Anarrhinum ecalcaratum, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually linear and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Anarrhinum ecalcaratum is often found in coastal dunes and is considered a drought-tolerant species.
